testCase.expectations:

  - No level/joiner words like "basic", "intermediate", "advanced", "fundamentals", etc
  - No words like "course" in the title
  - Titles are always in Title Case

steps.conclusion: None. The output follows language, format, and structural rules; no safety or instruction-violation issues found.
None. Titles are in Title Case, single-topic without joiners, and descriptions are exactly one sentence in Brazilian Portuguese.

Possible minor Title Case inconsistency: "Teoría del Delito" uses lowercase "del"; the instructions say to always use Title Case, which could imply capitalizing all major words ("Teoría Del Delito"). Also, "Proceso Penal" might be less canonical than "Derecho Procesal Penal" in some curricula, though still acceptable.

Could add a few more relevant suggestions such as "Derecho", "Política Criminal", "Derecho Penitenciario" or "Victimología" to broaden options; tighten descriptions to emphasize learner benefits more explicitly; ensure strict Title Case across all titles if interpreted literally.
